thread.title: Tacoma man gets 20 years for fatal dispute over portable speaker
thread.title_full: Tacoma man gets 20 years for fatal dispute over portable speaker | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Tacoma man gets 20 years for fatal dispute over portable speaker
text:
A Tacoma man has been sentenced to 20 years in prison for stabbing a man to death during a dispute over a portable speaker.
The News Tribune reports that 39-year-old Marcus Thornton was sentenced in Pierce County Superior Court on Thursday.
Prosecutors say Thornton stabbed 35-year-old John Scott Ware Jr. to death in September 2014 because he thought the other man had stolen a speaker from him.
Several neighbors reported hearing a fight before the stabbing and seeing a man standing over Ware as he lay on the ground.
